qas.question: In what year did France move into Alger?
In 1831, who was the strongest vassal of the Ottoman Empire?
Who wanted to take over Constantinople?
What military force did Mahmud II ask for aid?
How many Russians troops were sent to the Bosphorus shores?

context: France used the right moment and occupied Alger in <a0_0>1830<a0_0/>. In 1831 <a1_0>Muhammad Ali of Egypt<a1_0/>, who was the most powerful vassal of the Ottoman Empire, claimed independence. Ottoman forces were defeated in a number of battles, and <a2_0>Egyptians<a2_0/> were ready to capture Constantinople, which forced the sultan Mahmud II to seek for <a3_0>Russian<a3_0/> military aid. <a4_0>10 000<a4_0/> Russian army corps landed on the Bosphorus shores in 1833 and helped to prevent the capture of Constantinople, thus the possible disappearance of the Ottoman Empire was prevented.
